ol.li: Extends _ Medication Administration Event

Contains exactly one [1..1] actualIvLimitation with data type String
This is the maximum length of time to administer, or the maximum volume to administer, for IV fluid orders. The value may be in ML or CC for milliliters, L for liters, D for days, or H for hours.

Contains exactly one [1..1] infusionRate with data type Rate Quantity
Infusion: "Introduction of a solution into the body through a vein for therapeutic purposes." (American Heritage Stedman's Medical Dictionary). This is the rate at which the solution is introduced into the body. Expressed as volume/time (e.g., 500 ml/hr)

Contains exactly one [1..1] syringeSize with data type String
Size of the syringe to be used to administer IV.

Extends _ Medication Administration Event

Contains exactly one [1..1] dateTime with data type Point In Time
The date and time that the medication was or will be administered.
Contains exactly one [1..1] bodySite with data type Code
Contains exactly one [1..1] route with data type Code

Contains exactly one [1..1] dosageOrdered with data type Real
This is the amount of the medication the patient is to receive as one dose for this order. This should be an amount with a unit of measure, such as '500MG' or '50cc'. THIS SHOULD NOT BE THE NUMBER OF TABLETS, ETC.

Contains exactly one [1..1] frequency with data type Time Interval
Specifies when the substance is to be administered and how frequently. Note that this is a complex data type that may indicate specific times or intervals (e.g., 10:00 AM, MWF, etc).

Contains exactly one [1..1] patientLocation with data type String
Free text; location (room, bed and ward) of the patient at the time of the medication administration.

Contains exactly one [1..1] status with data type Code
The current state of the Substance Administration. Possible values include: Infusing, Given, Held, Completed, etc.

Contains exactly one [1..1] actualIvLimitation with data type String
This is the maximum length of time to administer, or the maximum volume to administer, for IV fluid orders. The value may be in ML or CC for milliliters, L for liters, D for days, or H for hours.
